marketImpactScore.name: Market Impact Score
marketImpactScore.definition: A weighted composite measuring how current political risk levels are likely affecting financial market indicators. Calculated by weighting each political risk category by its empirical sensitivity to each market indicator, then averaging across all market indicators.
marketImpactScore.interpretation: Higher scores indicate greater downward pressure on equity markets, upward pressure on volatility and credit spreads, and increased currency risk. A score of 7+ suggests markets are pricing in significant political risk premium.

economicImpactScore.name: Economic Impact Score
economicImpactScore.definition: A weighted composite measuring how current political risk levels are likely affecting real economic activity. Calculated by weighting each political risk category by its empirical sensitivity to each economic indicator, then averaging across all economic indicators.
economicImpactScore.interpretation: Higher scores indicate reduced GDP growth potential, weaker business investment, declining consumer confidence, and reduced foreign capital inflows. A score of 7+ suggests meaningful drag on economic growth.
